üöÄ JAX Acceleration in Action

Experience the power of automatic hardware acceleration

‚ö° 5.53x

GPU Acceleration

Linear Regression on 100K√ó1K dataset

0.060s vs 0.331s (scikit-learn)

üß† Auto

Smart Selection

Automatically chooses CPU/GPU/TPU

Based on data size and algorithm

üîÑ Zero

Code Changes

Just replace import statement

import xlearn as sklearn

Quick Example:

# Before: import sklearn
import xlearn as sklearn  # üöÄ That's it!

# Everything else stays the same
model = sklearn.linear_model.LinearRegression()
model.fit(X, y)  # Automatically uses GPU if beneficial

Classification ‚ö° JAX

Identifying which category an object belongs to with JAX acceleration.

Applications: Spam detection, image recognition.
JAX-Accelerated: logistic regression, nearest neighbors.
Traditional: Gradient boosting, random forest, and more...

Examples

Regression ‚ö° JAX

Predicting continuous values with up to 5x faster JAX acceleration.

Applications: Drug response, stock prices.
JAX-Accelerated: LinearRegression, Ridge, Lasso.
Traditional: Gradient boosting, random forest, and more...

Examples

Clustering ‚ö° JAX

Automatic grouping with GPU/TPU acceleration for large datasets.

Applications: Customer segmentation, grouping experiment outcomes.
JAX-Accelerated: K-Means (5x+ faster).
Traditional: HDBSCAN, hierarchical clustering, and more...

Examples

Dimensionality reduction ‚ö° JAX

Reducing dimensions with JAX-accelerated linear algebra.

Applications: Visualization, increased efficiency.
JAX-Accelerated: PCA, TruncatedSVD.
Traditional: feature selection, NMF, and more...

Examples

Model selection

Comparing, validating and choosing parameters and models.

Applications: Improved accuracy via parameter tuning.
Algorithms: Grid search, cross validation, metrics, and more...

Examples

Preprocessing ‚ö° JAX

Feature extraction and normalization with JAX acceleration.

Applications: Transforming input data for ML algorithms.
JAX-Accelerated: StandardScaler, MinMaxScaler.
Traditional: feature extraction, and more...
